title.rendered: 6 Tips On How To Choose The Right Course Creation Tool

content.rendered:
If you have a topic that you are passionate about, then creating an online course is the perfect way to share your knowledge with others.

However, you have to be a professional to create a course, as you will be calling yourself an expert in your topic. This means that you have to really know what you’re talking about and have top-notch expertise on the subject! Before diving into making a course, there are a few things that you should consider first. One of the first things is choosing the right course creation tool for your needs. There are a lot of tools out there that you can use, so read this article to find out how to pick the one that is right for you.

1) How Much Money Are You Willing To Spend?

One of the first things that you need to think about when creating a course is how much money you are willing to spend. This includes the cost of the tool, as well as any other expenses that you may incur along the way. Some tools are free to use, while others have a monthly subscription fee. For example, the Teachable tool is cheaper compared to Thinkific, so if the price is a major factor for you, then Teachable is the better option. In addition to this, you should also think about some extra costs you might encounter along the way. For example, you might need to hire a professional videographer to shoot your videos if you are not proficient in video production.

2) What Type Of Learner Are You Trying To Reach?

Another thing to consider is who you are trying to reach with your course. If you want to attract busy professionals, then a tool that offers mobile compatibility is a good choice. Alternatively, if you want to reach students, then a tool that offers a lot of built-in features, such as quizzes and discussion forums, might be a better option. It’s important to think about your target audience and choose a tool that caters to their needs. You should conduct a survey and read reviews to find out who your ideal learners are and what they want.

3) What Are Your Course Goals?

It is also vital that you think about what your course goals are before picking a tool. This means thinking about where you want to take your course in the future, as well as how much time and effort you’re willing to put in. If you want to create a course that is solely for your own personal use, then a tool that is easy to use and doesn’t require a lot of technical knowledge might be the best option for you. However, if you want to create a course that has the potential to make you money, then you need to choose a tool that is more versatile and offers more features. Keep these things in mind before making a purchase and you will find the ideal tool for your needs.

4) What Types Of Content Do You Want To Share?

This is probably the most crucial thing to consider when choosing a tool. Some tools are more suitable for certain types of courses, so you need to think about your content before purchasing a product. For example, if you plan on having a lot of videos in your course, then a video-editing tool might be the best choice for you. If not, a more basic tool with lots of templates might be a better option. You should also think about whether you want to use branching logic, as well as how many quizzes and discussion forums you expect your students to participate in. These things will influence what you need the most and help you make an educated decision when choosing your product. But, don’t forget about your learners and what they want!

5) What Kind Of Support Do You Need?

This is another important factor to consider when choosing a course creation tool. It’s vital that you think about whether you need help setting up your course or if you want a tool that is easy to use from the get-go. Some tools offer a lot of support, such as online tutorials, chat support, or FAQs, while others do not. If you’re not confident in your ability to use a tool, then you should choose one that has more support. Alternatively, if you want a tool that is easy to use and doesn’t require any setup, then you should look for a product that is designed for beginners. On the other hand, if you feel like a pro and you think that support isn’t necessary, then a more complex option might be the right choice for you.

6) Which Features Are Most Important To You?

The final thing to think about before buying a course creation tool is what features are most important to you. This means deciding what you want your course to look like and how you want it to function. Do you need a tool that offers a lot of templates? Or do you need one that has branching logic so you can create different paths for your students? Are you interested in using social media to market your course? If so, then a tool that offers integration with popular platforms, such as Facebook and Twitter, is a good choice. You should sit down and make a list of your must-haves and nice-to-haves before making a purchase. This will help you narrow down your options and find the perfect tool for your needs.

Learning how to create your own course is a lot of work. Because there are many factors that go into the process, you need to think about what kind of learner you want and whether or not it will be for personal use only. There’s also thinking about what type of content you’ll share in your courses- videos? quizzes? discussion forums? All these things play an important role when deciding which tool is right for you! We hope you found this article helpful and we wish you the best of luck with your course creation!

About the Author

Blake Kohl is an ed-tech enthusiast with a passion for writing on emerging technologies in the areas of corporate training and education.  With years of experience in the freelance writing industry, Blake has become proficient in creating content that captivates the audience, drives growth, and educates.
